website_summaries.verdict: Unique design yields a powerful mouthguard that's about half as thick as others.
pros: Thin design of this mouthguard allows wearer to talk easily and use it comfortably
One of the thinnest mouthguards on the market
Offered in a dozen color choices
Distributes impact forces over the full area of the mouthpiece
cons: Not made for children 10 and younger

customer_reviews.title: Not just for sports
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I don’t use this for sports. I have a horrible case of bruxism (sleep grinding) and bought this to help me because most products OTC are so thick they trigger my gag reflex. Because of the slim size and unique material of this mouthguard, it has been helping me finally get a night of sleep. I have chewed it up a bit, but it still works. I cut the excess off the corners and stuck it to the pressure points on my mouthguard to reinforce it. You guys should really consider making a product for bruxism. This is different than most other things. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: The Mendietas

customer_reviews.title: Heck to the NOPE
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how anyone gave this thing a positive review, it’s quite possibly the dumbest and poorest designed product I’ve ever seen. Does not mold to mouth correctly. There is not enough material to mold it effectively and there is not enough material to enable this to provide any reasonable protection whether playing sports or using as a bite guard while sleeping. You might as well shape a large wad of gum into a mouth guard shape...you’d get the same result, and prob more comfortable. This is garbage and shouldn’t be allowed to be sold.
customer_reviews.author: Real Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: ... on a mouth guard I bought at a sporting good store so I tried this one and it's amazing
customer_reviews.text: I play rugby was constantly gagging on a mouth guard I bought at a sporting good store so I tried this one and it's amazing. It did take several times of reheating to get it to fit right however, I wore it an entire match and didn't notice it, could talk, drink, with no problem. Glad I switched.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Works exactly as advertised. My kid can breath easier, drink and speak clearly. But even better is that it took us 4 attempts to mold it correctly and each time we put it back into the hot water, it unfolded and looked new. One time he even bit through the material, causing holes and I figured I'd have to buy another one. But, after placing back in the water, it flattened out again and the holes even sealed up. Remarkable product. And let me add that my kid turned 12 last month and we got the adult size. Nice fit.
customer_reviews.author: staffordScott

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: I don’t even know where to start with this one. Maybe just don’t buy it? We have owned a lot of mouthguards with 2 sporty kids and this - by far - was the worst of the bunch. It pinched my son’s cheeks in that it would catch (yet it was super easy to mold). He also felt like there was zero protection provided. It didn’t really “lock in” and he didn’t feel like he could bite or clamp down quite right. Convenient- yes. Protective - didn’t seem like it. Comfortable - definitely not.
customer_reviews.author: 2Boys3Dogs

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars — SISU Mouth Guard
customer_reviews.text: Despite the instruction video, I found the mouth guard a bit hard to mold to my teeth. I think that that’s more because I have a smaller mouth and some crooked teeth. LOL Still, I’ve observed others who use SISU in the roller derby community, and they all rave about it. I like that it gives you plenty of tries to mold the guard! That’s definitely helpful. Things I recommend would be to use near boiling water, especially if remoulding. Have bright lighting, it’s difficult to line up the guard bite pad without it. Or, better yet, go to your dentist! They’ll do it right the first time! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Mel H

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT I NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: I am a terrible teeth grinder in the middle of the night when I should be sleeping! Up until I found these SISU products, I was bound, and not in a good way, to my dentist, for what they deem a night guard. I was being charged $75.00 for a custom made appliance they promised would work!! NOT When I came upon these SISU products on Amazon, I hand had nothing to loose except more teeth, and gave it a try! The results are stunning!!!!I have two of the adult sizes and one is for a young adult and they are just what I needed! If you have these problems, you owe it to yourself to try these!
customer_reviews.author: waterloggedut

customer_reviews.title: Will try to return it
customer_reviews.text: This might be the worst mouth guard I’ve ever used in my 10+ years of combat sports. I bet with a professional fitting it’s amazing. But even with help from 2 professional fighters, cornermen and coaches we couldn’t get it. Because it’s flat or because my mouth is small it just won’t properly form when I do the folding. It has these huge billows/creases that form as your folding it over. After 20 attempts we just said f it and I used the gyms $3 mouth guard which is at least pre “folded/molded”. And it didn’t even come with a case. For shame. I guess it just depends on your mouth shape?
customer_reviews.author: A. Reader

customer_reviews.title: I don't gag
customer_reviews.text: I have a very sensitive gag reflex and no matter how short I made other mouthguard, I'd always gag which is not helpful in the middle of practice or a game. The first time I made it a little too tight for my liking, it fit like a retainer, you could even here it click into place. I redid it and just didn't suck quite as hard. It still fits like a retainer (in a good way, as rugby is full contact) but it was much more comfortable. The best part...I never gag, I can talk and don't have to take it out repeatedly in between plays.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I guess it’s my fault for not realizing I needed to mold this myself but this thing is still a huge disappointment. It’s just a flat piece of plastic you heat and “mold” which didn’t work at all. Even if it had, I don’t see how this could be protective at all. It feels like biting down on a guitar pick.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Like a Super-Hard Baggie Over Yr Teeth
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: I have NOT taken a puck off the teeth with this thing so i cannot speak to its protective quality. I can, however, note that it is insanely low profile. It's the closest thing to tartar build up I've ever worn. It is incredibly breathable & the molding process locks it to your teeth's contours. It takes a few tries to get it to mold correctly but once you figure it out, it basically becomes your teeth. I'll update just as soon as I know if a puck destroys my immaculate grill with this thing in or not.
customer_reviews.author: LRHR

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Ok I’ve been doing combat sports my entire life. And I’ve always gagged on the mouth guards. I’ve tried every big brand. The Doc that shocks, etc. and I’ve always had to stop rolling in bjj to try to remove my mouth guard. This thing WORKS. It’s super thin and super skinny, but still offers awesome protection. It’s pretty easy to mold. The instructions are very clear. It’s awkward to push into place. But once it firms up some it’s very easy to set and mold. The guard has marks on it for aligning your teeth. I molded mine about six times and it’s still holding up great. It’s a stellar piece for the price. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Talk and Drink While Wearing
customer_reviews.text: Tricky if you have a bigger or smaller jaw. There are areas your back teeth are supposed to line up with but I found my mouth shape did not quit meatch. Some of my back teeth are not covered but everything is otherwise protected and I have been playing roller derby for over 5 years and I own two of these. This is a hard mouthguard, not remotely soft nor is it meant to be soft. I love being able to talk and drink without having to remove it, but if you acidentally have you toungue out and you fall, it's a painful experience when you accidentally bite your toungue, cheek or lip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, not too bulky
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old son is a goalkeeper on a select soccer team so we insist on him wearing a mouth guard while playing. He has tried several styles in the past (from Dicks Sports) and they were always bulky, made it difficult to talk, and did not fit well. He loves this SISU 1.6mm guard. Once we fit it to his mouth, it stays in place well, he can talk and yell (which keepers need to do on the field), and it matches his team colors :). I have purchased this exact guard twice as he lost the first one. Highly recommend a good carrying case for it
customer_reviews.author: Wolfedogger

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get right, doesn't soften at the specified temp, had to go higher. It kind of ruffled at the top of my gums and when I heated it up again to smooth them out it stretched too thin... No going back. Plus I read another review of a guy that broke two of his teeth with this guard in... Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Molding the mouth guard is pretty easy, just follow the directions. However, the first time I wore it for use, it was REALLY tight. It made my teeth hurt. I remolded it and used less pressure to mold it. Still terrible. Molded it again, and used just enough pressure to shape it, but absolutely no more. This mold was slightly better, but still too tight. The material they use shrinks as it cools. For me, this was just too uncomfortable. I really wanted to like it, as the low profile and ease of talking was nice. However, if you never wear it because it hurts, it is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: no protection
customer_reviews.text: this thing conforms to your teeth (with creases on the outside), stays attached to your upper teeth, but it's so thin, I can't imagine it offering ANY protection. I might as well be biting down on paper. I'd recommend this to someone who is required to wear a mouth guard for their sport but doesn't want to, or just needs to learn to keep their jaw clenched during certain activities. But seriously, biting on a plastic bottlecap would be better from a protection standpoint.
customer_reviews.author: Jake B.

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: I play rugby and it's important to be able to talk when wearing a mouth guard. I like this mouth guard because it is low-profile, so you can open/close your mouth and speak clearly. It also stays in place and it only comes off if I consciously take it off. Other mouth guards just fall out if you don't make a concerted effort to suction it to your top teeth. I found myself attempting to do that out of habit, and as it turns out, this mouth guard fits better than any other I've had. The only down side is that the holes of the mouth guard are a little rough once they are formed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these. Two white and one black for my two sons and my nephew who all play varsity football and who all notoriously chew through mouth guards. After watching the YouTube videos and reading ever review possible they just so happen to go in sale here in Amazon. Two months into the season and they are still holding up and haven't been chewed through. After the season my son will be back in the boxing ring and I'll update again on the quality of these mouth guards Ina different sport. Bottom line is these are so far the best mouth guards I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Wiring

customer_reviews.title: #1 choice
customer_reviews.text: I only use sisu for roller derby as do most of my teammates. Easy to mold and easy to fix if you mess up. Great variety in colors. I can drink water with it in and communicate clearly with my teammates on the track. I have used both the original and nextgen- since I've started jamming, I prefer the nextgen as I feel like it helps me combat that cotton mouth feeling. They are easy to clean. I soak mine in mouthwash and brush with a toothbrush to get in all the crevices. I accidentally stained my first white one with derby makeup but it still does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth guard - hard to fit
customer_reviews.text: Changed the formula. Have fitted probably ten of these before and this one was the most difficult. The material used to get so pliable it would almost become clear. No matter how hot I got the water I never got that pliability. It took me almost 15 times to get a decent fit. Still not thrilled with the fit but spent over 45 mins doing something that typically took me ten before. I will continue to support Sisu because they’ve kept my teeth in place after 6 years of derby. I still have faith that this one will protect my teeth just not thrilled with the thickness or how comfortable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Solonicole17

customer_reviews.title: Can heat and reform many time! Not recommended with braces!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter plays lacrosse and hockey and I am tired of buying new mouthguard because she chews on them. This mouthguard is great because if it gets to formed you can just heat it up again and reform it. We have reformed it at least a dozen times. I definitely recommend it. I do not recommend it was braces. We tried to use it once she got braces and almost couldn’t get it off because it forms around them. Other than that it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Sp

customer_reviews.title: If I could give 0 * I would
customer_reviews.text: Fitting this was a nightmare. Its sticky when moldable. Recommends getting it out of hot water with a fork, it stuck to the metal fork. Sticks to fingers. Molding it onto a teens mouth was like herding cats. Would be hard to mold on yourself let alone someone else. Had our teens orthodontist mold it as instructucted and it looked like a horror project. Time between ready to fit and hardness was less than 30 seconds. Ultimately threw it away after 10+ attempts at fitting. Not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I wear this for the entire class session
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my old mouthguard which I only put in when I'm sparring, I wear this usually the entire class session for martial arts. I can talk, breathe easily, drink water, no problem. Only caution would be probably that it won't provide much " cushion" if you are getting hit in the face like if you are boxing, but for the accidental chin contact that comes with other activity like grappling this will help you avoid biting your lip/tongue/cheek or slamming your teeth together. This was worth it over other mouthguards. Pretty easy to fit too!
customer_reviews.author: JNewmm

customer_reviews.title: Hockey mom upset!
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the most frustrating mouth guard we have ever encountered! We followed the directions again and again and again to try to get the best fit. We ended up after 45 minutes of frustration eating the money I paid for it and throwing the thing away! Never again!!!!!! We ended up with what I called a crappy piece of cheese and luckily an extra old school mouth piece In the basement to boil and get to work!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Tomon

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth guard, we will never use another one!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a mouth guard for Her roller derby team and her coach recommended this brand. It is her fav!! We are so happy to get this one for her. She has tried a lot of different ones in the past and they were all so uncomfortable. She can speak clearly, drink her water etc... with this new mouth guard. It’s the best out there for sure. We had an easy time fitting it too. Wasn’t hard at all. It’s been a few months and it’s still holding up wonderfully with zero problems! Get it, you’ll be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second SISU mouth guard I have purchased for my 11 year-old lacrosse player. I had a hard time fitting the first one and had to make a few attempts, but the way the material works you can keep dropping it in the hot water and starting over. Once I was able to get it formed correctly it made a very custom fit... more so than some of the bulky mouth guards we've tried. It's also super light and breathable. She hasn't taken a hit to the mouth so I can't speak to the protection, but I'm pleased with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mayes

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR, SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Our trainers recommended this brand to us for derby. I personally don't see how it will help since it's rather thin (and pricey), BUT you can talk with it, drink with it, and it's not going anywhere. I tend to play with my mouth guards, shifting them with my tongue, but it's staying put, which is GREAT! Not bad molding, just have to be careful and fast. I used a butter knife to get mine out of the water. Took a few times to mold it right, but It's ok. :D
customer_reviews.author: Kris May

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really write reviews but I need to warn people about this item. This item is worse then trash..A complete waste of cash, you’re better off buying something cheaper then this with more foam to protect you’re teeth. This item had no protection at all and is very very slim to the point that feels like you have paper in you’re mouth then a mouth guard. The picture is very Deceiving it
customer_reviews.author: Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great for speaking. Hard and uncomfortable,mediocre protection
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a glove.If you need minimal protection and the ability to speak clearly its great. However there is literally no cushioning and the feel is like hard plastic making it less comfortable and most likely less protective. also athletes like to chew their mouthguard a bit and this one does not give at all. I would never consider wearing this out on the wrestling mat.A quarterback on the other hand would LOVE this. So the review really depends on what you're using it for.
customer_reviews.author: Supernovadramaqueen

customer_reviews.title: Best mouthguard on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mouthguard on the market. I have 2. I love that it doesn't impact your breathing and you can drink water easily without taking it out. I actually forget I'm wearing it. I do regret buying a white one. I got a little blood in it a month ago. It dried brownish in the little holes. I've tried everything to get it white again. I'm sure it's fine from a hygiene perspective, but it looks gross when I'm putting it in. I'm buying a colored one to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: I don't  like it.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly difficult to get it to fit properly, because the edges would make a crease with pointed edges. The only way I was anle to fit it somewhat comfortable was to trim the edges with kitchen scissors so that the edges wouldn't make such a sharp crease. I literally filed out the edges so that it won't cut the inside of my mouth. Finally, when I did wear it while doing grappling. I got accidentally kneed on the mouth "luckily" I was wearing the Sisu mouthguard. The edges of the moutb guard cut through the inside of my mouth. I don't like it. One star.
customer_reviews.author: regular-dude

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t mold well
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a crown replacement and my old mouthguard no longer fit me. This seemed like a perfect option since I was looking for a very breathable mouthguard for jiujitsu. Compared to my old one, this mouthguard was sooo much harder to mold to my teeth. I tried 5 times and still couldn’t quite get it right. My husband and I both do jiujitsu and he has a custom fit mouthguard from our dentist. I think it’d be better to get a custom fit one at this point even though there is a huge price difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Armitage

customer_reviews.title: Suspect this was not actually a SISU Mouth Guard but I know it became  A Melted Blob of Nothing.
customer_reviews.text: My sons have used the SISU Mouth Guards previously and they have been great mouth guards. The boys were able to wear them comfortably and remold if braces were adjusted. I purchased this as a backup and finally needed to use it last week (July 10, 2019). When warmed to be molded the entire thing melted into a viscous, syrupy blob. I know this is not supposed to happen nor is it what has happened with the Authentic SISU guards we have had previously. I do not believe we actually received a real SISU Mouth Guard Aero 1.6mm Custom Fit Sports Mouth Guard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a good fitment tip-- I was not able to get a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a good fitment tip-- I was not able to get a good fit the very first time I heated the mouthguard. No worries as you can reheat and try again, over and over. One thing that really helped was to leave the basic shape and just heat up the problem area rather than starting from scratch melting the whole thing. I was able to really fine tune the fit in this way and am VERY happy with the results. Very comfortable, low profile. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BrittMarie

customer_reviews.title: Low Profile Mouth Guard
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled with Mouthguards for many years. The bulk of most mouthguards triggers my gag reflex as I progress through different workouts. Back when I boxed, I used to throw up a lot because of bulkier mouth guards. I grabbed the SISU guard because it looked pretty small and fitted it before Jiujitsu. It was only a few hours after class that I realized I wore the guard the entire class and hardly realized it was there. For anyone that has trouble with mouthguards, I can't recommend this one enough.
customer_reviews.author: Yunqi Au

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to find a mouthguard for my teenage son who started lacrosse this year. He's never played a sport that requires a mouthguard, so he was pretty fussy about it. When we found this one - and in his school color of orange to boot - we found a winner! Would repurchase in future seasons as needed, but it's still in good shape after this first one.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy C.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: First and only mouth guard I've ever used but I definitely have nothing negative to say about it. Took a few times to mold it right but it wasnt super difficult or anything. I actually forget it's in my mouth half the time. I can talk and drink fine with it in.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit products out there buyer beware of third party sellers!
customer_reviews.text: Best product on the market for mouth guards! I use mine for braziallian jiu jitsu and it is the perfect size. Not too large where I feel like gagging like my other shock doctor. Look out for counterfeit products! Only buy from Amazon directly not by any third party sellers. I received a counterfeit product that fell apart after I molded it the first time! Sisu has great customer service and replaced it at no charge to me even though it wasn’t their product. Sisu is awesome and stands by their product. It’s unfortunate some crooks are trying to tarnish the brand name!
customer_reviews.author: Rxist858

customer_reviews.title: Great for Roller Derby and Krav Maga
customer_reviews.text: Yooo, this mouthguard is boss. I use it for roller derby and krav maga. In both these sports I have to keep the mouthguard in pretty much the entire time and with other larger guards, its hard to speak, drink water, breathe and end up having to put my dirty hands to take it in and out. However, this one is form fitting, protective and allows me to keep it in the whole class or session with ease and comfort. I've fallen so many times in derby and been hit in every kind of way in Krav and this guard has protected my teeth. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Works Great - Even with Braces
customer_reviews.text: The very first day my 11 year old got her braces we tried to wear the mouthguard provided by her orthodontist at soccer practice. It was so big and bulky that we quickly gave up. Within 10 minutes my daughter got hit in her mouth and knocked 3 brackets off her very sore teeth. I was determined to find a mouthguard that would help with this. The Sisu Aero guard works great! The tinfoil trick prevented the mouthguard from getting caught on the brackets and after a couple of attempts we got it. She wears it without complaint in practice and games and she can eat, breathe, and drink with it in just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: TDDS

customer_reviews.title: Thin mouth guard doesn't impede speech or drinking while in.
customer_reviews.text: I have crooked teeth and it took me six or seven times of heating and reheating, trying to line up the bite guard correctly. Nothing wrong with the design or the instructions just having a malocclusion makes it much more work to get correctly done. Now that I gave it done the best I could get it fits pretty comfortably. I can speak clearly and drink without having to pop it out as I refuse to touch the guard and put it back in mouth if I had filthy hand from rolling(BJJ).
customer_reviews.author: Putrid Cadaver

customer_reviews.title: Protective
customer_reviews.text: So I do roller derby, which is full contact. It works. Only thing is I have a pretty small mouth, so shaping it was very difficult for me. If I got the back good, the front wasn’t. And vice versa. That’s just because I have a tiny mouth. Anyway, I’d recommend. It’s really easy to shape and it’s easy to talk with if you fit it right. I sound all slurpy, but again that’s my problem. I 100% recommend this brand. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ninanoo

customer_reviews.title: READ MOLDING INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: Still gave this a 5 star because the issue was our mistake. If you've molded tons of mouthpieces and think this will be the same you will end up with mouthpiece soup as we did. We had ordered a second one, thoroughly went over instruction particularly the time to keep in hot water and every thing went well. My son is a Quarterback and says these make it so much easier to breathe and talk
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, diffulicult to mold
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to mold. Because it is so thin it kept wrinkling up and making folds (three shown in the picture). I also could not get it to stay in my mouth once it hardened. I tried several times to remold it but only got frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Khristian R.

customer_reviews.title: Play rugby... I like it
customer_reviews.text: I do like this mouth guard a lot! You can definitely breath and drink with it in. I haven't have any bad experiences with it. I have taken a lot of hits but overall it feels comforting to have it in! I definitely have ran one through the dryer a few times, kind of a bummer but you just remold it! A bunch of teammates use them.. No issues on a team of 20+ women.. Get bright colors so when your drop it it is easy to find..
customer_reviews.author: T and H

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, can breathe, talk and drink.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty rigid in you mouth, fits very securely. I wear it for BJJ so I don’t regularly get bit in the mouth. I wouldn’t recommend for boxing or mma I don’t think. It’ll save your teeth, i dont know about getting knocked out though. I’m not gonna be the one to test the theory though.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat
customer_reviews.text: My daughter saw these advertised on a you tube video and had to have them. They are easy to mold and you can really have a conversation with them in. She has been remoulding them now for the fourth time and it is giving her some difficulty. I am hoping that it was user error.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Breathable, molds well, worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I love love LOVE this mouthguard! I got it for Quidditch, which is a sport you talk to your teammates a lot while you’re running. This is much better than the Walmart mouthguard I had before. The only issue was that I had a bit of a tricky time molding it, but it was nice that it could mold so specifically to your mouth. Nearly all my teammates have this brand. It’s great. I do notice it in my mouth but that’s only bc I like to have my mouth guards slightly loose.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Mold
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to mold correctly because it is so flimsy. I softened it three different times before I finally gave up and accepted the fit you see in the photo. I’ll probably try to refit it later. Not impressed for the price. I gave it two stars because I am still using it, so it is functional, just difficult to mold.
customer_reviews.author: McKelveys

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouthguard I have ever Used.
customer_reviews.text: This mouth guard is awesome, I use it for Ice Hockey, I still wear a full cage but just fill more secure wearing it. The fit is perfect and can be remolded over and over. After about 5 games i clean it with vinegar and little bit of hydrogen peroxide to make it new again. It gets dirty because i drink Gatorade during that games, but it stays clean and bright green after about 20 games of using it. Love that you can talk with it in,
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Great mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: My kids have used these for 4+ years and love them. Work great. Can totally talk while in your mouth. Dont choke you either. A little tedious to mold but can easily be re-molded (dont let it fold on itself). We had trouble molding with braces but w/o braces this is a great mouth guard!
customer_reviews.author: matt M

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY mouthguard
customer_reviews.text: If you play contact sports, this is the only mouthguard you will ever need. It has held up and protected my mouth from some real hard Roller Derby hits. Unlike most, it is remoldable and comfortable. You can drink and talk easily with it. The only mouthguard I will recommend and use.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: My football players say this is the absolute best mouthpiece. It has a more compact design so that they can still talk normally with it in their mouth. Neither of my kids have braces so I cannot report how they would work with braces.
customer_reviews.author: Boymom

customer_reviews.title: Great but hard to fit
customer_reviews.text: This is for my daughter. I’m always frustrated with getting these to mold, the flat shape makes it hard to line up. Also, she has a small mouth (11yr old) so we always need to redo it a few times to get right. It would most likely be no problem if you were able to do it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Busser

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, lightweight and not noticeable when I’m wearing it. I have TMJ and this is the only mouth guard that isn’t over bulky, causing jaw pain. I am a competitive power lifter, and will for sure be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Small and still protects.
customer_reviews.text: I hate mouth guards. So much that I don't wear them. This thing is small enough to still drink water with, talk in without sounding like an idiot, and can be remolded very quickly. Wish I found this thing earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hightower

customer_reviews.title: Customizable and not bulky-- an excellent solution for players who need to communicate!
customer_reviews.text: Son is a lacrosse goalie who communicates regularly w/ his defenders. He researched and specifically requested this product and says he Loves it! Was easy to custom-fit to his mouth and allows him to speak Much more clearly. If he's happy (and confident), I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Suz of NC

customer_reviews.title: As great as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $7.50 in my team's color, when this thing is closer to $15-25. Talk about a steal! But yes, this mouthguard works great. Look on YouTube if you need video evidence of how good this thing is. Just make sure you register your mouthguard as soon as you get it, just in case something happens.
customer_reviews.author: IsaihaStuart

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth guard on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This past week I was hit in the mouth with a softball that took a bad hop. I had the SISU mouth guard in and all I had was a cut lip. No broken bones. No teeth missing. This thing works. I didn't think it would because it was so small and thin but it does. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Knasinski

customer_reviews.title: Worth considering for a grind guard
customer_reviews.text: It's a tight fit if you want that. I redid mine 3 times with zero issues to get just the right fit. I was going to try to use this as a bite guard for grinding at night. I found it to be a bit too cumbersome. It may work for you though. It's probably worth a try since a professional bite guard is a few hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Once you use SISU you will not go back to the old boil and bite guards. Use for BJJ/Judo and never even know I have it in. Can talk and drink water without removing it. Feels very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garage for $15. I tried molding it 3 time and it still does not work. It looking like what they show. Will return if I can.
customer_reviews.author: Lake girl

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I play sax and I also grind my teeth on occasion at night. this is great for both. Not only does it keep the pressure of my mouthpiece off my top front teeth, but it fits well and does not impede my playing. Added extra bonus is that it comes in one of our band colors. I find it durable and I like the slim fit of it. I would recommend it and in fact, already have.
customer_reviews.author: Kat O

customer_reviews.title: GOOD MOUTHGAURD!
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERRY good mouthguard. It is a little hard to mold but it only takes about 2 times. I can easily talk, breathe, and drink. And they even cover up to $35,000 of dental warranty. I will definitely recommend this to my friends. I will NEVER buy any other mouthguard again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W.

customer_reviews.title: The best mouthguard out there
customer_reviews.text: I love these! The color options, the dental coverage, and most importantly, the fact that you can remold it so many times without worry! As long as you mold it correctly, it'll fit well and you can talk and drink with it in. I recommend this to all my newbie leaguemates.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thankfully Untested
customer_reviews.text: Luckily I haven't had to test it's protection claims but it molded and worked very well. I was able to talk pretty well with it in and it stayed where it was supposed to. The only downside is that The tops of the guard at first were poking/hitting my gums which irritated me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kilroy

customer_reviews.title: Much better than traditional  mouth guards
customer_reviews.text: This is a very thin mouth guard. It takes a few tries to get it fit right due to coming flat. My daughter likes it better than the bulkier ones. She has a small mouth for her age. It would have been nice to have it shaped a little, since it is hard to fit is all at one time with it being flat. Very pleased with this mouth guard.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tanguay

customer_reviews.title: Not made for wrestling, judo or brazilian jiu jitsu
customer_reviews.text: It is way to thin and really does not provide the protection like the other mouthguards. I left my judo bag in the trunk and the darm thing shrunk. It's hard plastic and really has no give, when it shrunk in the cold weather, that was it for me. I went back to the jelly type mouthguard and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Tony from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and thin
customer_reviews.text: I started training BJJ two+ decades after my last sport requiring a mouthpiece. The training is intense and I had a gag reflex while breathing hard from some of the bigger/thicker mouthpieces. This one is much smaller and allows you to easily drink water and talk without taking the mouthpiece out, and I didn't have the gag reflex with this while gasping for air.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Great first mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: Instructions made it easy peazy and fit me perfectly. My first mouthpiece and I love it so far. Don’t know how much of a difference there is with the aero max but if it can withhold against mma impact this is really worth the money. Slim and molds around your teeth perfectly
customer_reviews.author: wonjoo j.

customer_reviews.title: At first I was skeptical and thought it was going to be too large (I have a small mouth) but it was fine. I just had to trim the end a ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and fitted it. At first I was skeptical and thought it was going to be too large (I have a small mouth) but it was fine.I just had to trim the end a little bit. Very easy to fit to your teeth-but like a lot of reviewers here, I used boiling water and made sure it didn't get too squishy. Haven't tried it out yet-but I plan on using it for roller derby. The thinness of it scares me a little but time will tell....
customer_reviews.author: Shannon G.

customer_reviews.title: These are the best mouthguard in the market
customer_reviews.text: These are the best mouthguard on the market. My 12yo son plays hockey and was intolerant of the typical plastic/gel mouthguard, as they were too bulky, obstructed his breathing and made it darn near impossible to drink water with the mouthguard in. With his SISU, I can understand him when he talks and I don’t have to fight with him to get him to wear it. Unlike other kids on his team that chew on theirs half in/half out of their mouths, my son feels comfortable enough to keep his in his mouth the whole game.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Looked a bit complicated, but it's actually very forgiving. We didn't get the fit right the first time, but was pleased that the hot water gave us a "reset." Perfect the second time, so don't stress if you mess up!! My daughter has used other mouthguards in the past, but this is the only one she can talk and drink without removing it. Fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Amy from Houston

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable, yet thin enough for me to talk with ease
customer_reviews.text: I’m used to thick rubbery mouth guards for different sports I played growing up. The Sisu mouth guard was great because it allowed me to reform/mold it a few times. I had dental work down and needed to alter the shape. This product allowed me to do that. With jiu jitsu, I know my teeth will be protected as it hardens and becomes very strong. It’s thin enough so I can talk with it in with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Harris

customer_reviews.title: I really like the color and thinness and the fact that you ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the color and thinness and the fact that you are able to remold the mouth guard several times. I only wish that I had ordered a youth mouth guard - if you have a small mouth like me, this might end up being too big. I couldn't get the material to lay all the way flat in the front due to the fact that there was too much of it for my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Sacks

customer_reviews.title: All that's promised
customer_reviews.text: This thing is unbelievable and all that's promised. The only aspect to be aware of is that because it's a harder plastic than most mouth guards, it can dig into your cheeks/gums if not fitted properly. I rushed through my first fitting and regretted it during class. The second fitting was much better. If you have a small mouth, I suspect the youth size will be more comfortable (although I haven't tried it yet - this one is just the smallest bit too big, so I'm hoping to make it work for me.)
customer_reviews.author: Galen D.

customer_reviews.title: dentist quality fit if you're patient
customer_reviews.text: bought this for BJJ, it took me maybe an hour or two to get it to fit just right, but now it's perfect. I totally endorse this thing, if you are in a sport where you should have a mouthguard but find that you often go without it, this is for you. I am considering using this to sleep as a nightguard because it is so comfortable. you can speak easily. great product.
customer_reviews.author: Deacon Frost

customer_reviews.title: I hardly know it’s there
customer_reviews.text: I hate wearing mouthguards (ice hockey) because it makes it so difficult to communicate and drink water. This one is super comfortable, very thin and very lightweight. While I hope I never have to rely on it for a direct shot to the mouth, I really like it and wear it consistently because it is so comfortable
customer_reviews.author: the g man

customer_reviews.title: Tightens way too much.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all... I re-did the hot water dip about 5 times because when it solidified it tightened around my teeth way too hard..! I wanted to use these for when I sleep to keep my teeth from grinding, but yeah, not happening at all! Just waste of money really.
customer_reviews.author: Min-T-Drop

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable perforation holes
customer_reviews.text: a bit uncomfortable where the holes were molded. Had a collision and the tiny perforation holes were abrasive to the inside of my mouth and left my lip a bit swollen. I tried re-molding to make it smoother but it didn't work. The low volume is nicer than my previous mouth guard but I don't feel like there is as much protection as with my mouth guard that covers both top and bottom teeth, but maybe that's just my perception.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jiu Jitsu Training
customer_reviews.text: Our entire family trains, Dad = Purple belt, Mom = White belt, Son and two daughters are been doing it for several years. I like this mouth guard for jiu jitsu because it is thin and protects your teeth from the occasional knee or elbow. When I train MMA I go with a full size mouth guard which I feel provides better repeated protection.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bracero

customer_reviews.title: Easy to form
customer_reviews.text: I'm a roller derby dad and its important to protect your child's teeth and jaw. We love this product because how easy it is to form and reform when necessary. This is the fith Sisu we have perchanced in to years so it's safe to say this lasts about six months for us. I just wish I could get her to STOP chewing on it may last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Average man

customer_reviews.title: Cracked within a week.
customer_reviews.text: The mouthpiece was hard to mold but once done it was comfortable but it cracked within a week. Tried to boil and fix but it did not work. Going to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Saved my teeth from a slapshot
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing this for hockey for a year now. Finally got unlucky and took a slapshot off a post to the mouth. Split my lip open bad, but the mouthguard kept all my teeth safe and sound. Literally the first thought was I was “I just lost 3 teeth”, and was extremely surprised and very happy when they were all there and fully in place, 0 damage. The mouthguard cracked and crumpled where it’s supposed to, and I have to buy a new one, but they made a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Kylesza

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to mold with hot water
customer_reviews.text: We followed instructions. Maybe we didn't do the hot water with enough heat, but it did NOT bend. This is for a kid, so I didn't want to burn her mouth - I gave up. Not sure how I return this ? The box is gone - thanks to over-diligent mother-in-law and I only got the plastic piece left.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mouth guard for BJJ and other grappling arts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 1.6 mm Aero to replace the 2.4 mm Max that I used for about a year...and this one is A LOT better for jiu-jitsu training! This is really saying something, because the Max was pretty good; I like being able to leave the mouth guard in for the entire training session and still comfortably breathe, talk, and drink. I've been using the Aero for about two weeks now and it's much more comfortable than the Max but I still feel like I'm adequately protected. This has SUPER HIGH VALUE for the price!
customer_reviews.author: tripelintegral

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable - means the youth will actually wear it and keep it in their mouth
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a goalie for her club and HS teams and really disliked other mouth guards because they made it harder to communicate with her teammates on the field. So - based on the fact that it's the first one she'll wear consistently it gets top marks from me. No damaged teeth yet - hopefully stays that way.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for BJJ easy to breath and doesn't gag you
customer_reviews.text: Its not bulky, I can breath a lot better then with traditional mouth guards. You can talk with it in your mouth. Some people complained in reviews about it cutting their lip or gums. This thing is mold-able, common sense just dip that part in warm water and slightly pull or adjust the part thats not fighting you correctly. Mine was rubbing against my gums and i fixed it and love it. My boys also do Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and they prefer it to other mouth guards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Don't waste your money! Did exactly as the instructions said. Wouldn't even form to my mouth. Hard as a rock! I'll spend the much extra money for a very good one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Dean Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan! Not sure protective.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to mold. Very thin to the point not sure how protective. Daughter plays Field Hockey - decided not to use as afraid it wouldn’t protect her if she were it with stick/ball for this sport.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Took a few tries to get it to mold correctly to my teeth, but has been working great ever since. My rugby team uses it and none have complained about the quality during contact. I use it as a night guard vs paying stupid amounts of money to dentists unnecessarily. Common sense note, I drank ginger and tumeric tea after having brushed my teeth .. and it dyed the white mouthguard. Since, I brush the mouth guard with tooth paste at least a couple of times a week and the color is already fading.
customer_reviews.author: Stina

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality !!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 7 in total ... 3 of them for my children and 4 for the children of my friends ... it's a shame !!!! 2 of the mouth guards, when proceeding to soften them with hot water, were never docile to be molded, despite trying repeatedly. The other 2 could be molded, however, after a couple of uses they were pulverized. The remaining 3 were not opened because it is assumed that they come in the same conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Carreno

customer_reviews.title: 3 Hockey players in this household
customer_reviews.text: After going through many brands throughout the years the family hockey players picked this as their favorite. Relatively easy to mold and not big and bulky like some other brands.
customer_reviews.author: D|N

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My daughter uses these for lacrosse. We are on our third one because she swears by these and has been using them for years. The color doesn’t fade, it’s durable and she can talk while wearing it. It’s worked great with and without braces.
customer_reviews.author: ToddL

customer_reviews.title: Need to sleep
customer_reviews.text: I lock my teeth while I sleep and didn't want to pay hundred for a mouth guide. I have tried other brands but they are really thick material. Really like this material. Thin but strong and was pretty easy to mold. I ended up getting Sisu Go style next since the guard is a little shorter and fits my mouth better.
customer_reviews.author: ginat

customer_reviews.title: I can talk.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old niece who plays roller derby. She loves it because she can talk with it in. I love it because she keeps out in her mouth the whole practice. It did take us a few tries to get the shape right, but it held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Secure
customer_reviews.text: First night I wore it my mouth was sore the next morning, not sure what that was about. It's a very different fit compared to the much looser fitting mouthguard I'm accustomed to using. I definitely recommend this one for active use, but not so much as a sleep guard. I think I need more cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Breath better
customer_reviews.text: Far much superior to the everyday mouth guard you find in stores. You can breath better, drink water and talk with it in your mouth. Biggest benefit is breathing better with the sisu. The other mouth guards take up too much room in your mouth hindering your breathing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good guard
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, looks good, durable. A little trickier to mold than the regular mouthguards, but worth it. Will purchase again as it is much more comfortable and a time saver to be able to keep it in and drink water. You can also still have a conversation while wearing it, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: me

product_meta.title: SISU Mouth Guards Aero 1.6mm Custom Fit Sports Mouthguard for Youth/Adults
product_meta.description: The SISU Aero Mouth Guard offers more protection with less mouth guard. Ideal for soccer, hockey, roller derby, lacrosse, basketball, and other contact team sports, SISU mouthguards feature a wide bite pad, rounded edges for comfort, and easy mold-ability to ensure a perfect fit. All SISU guards can be quickly and easily molded (and re-molded) at home with hot water. At only 1.6mm thick, or 50 percent thinner than conventional mouthguards, players wearing the super slim Aero can talk, breathe and hydrate with the guard in-place. Scientifically engineered with Diffusix technology, the non-compressible, perforated guard material distributes forces over a larger area to reduce risk of dental injury during competition. Guard is compatible with braces, but a dental professional should be consulted for fitting (Sizes Medium and Large are recommended for all ages wearing braces). Available in three sizes: Small fits the mouths of children ages 7-10, or athletes up to 5 feet tall; Medium fits average mouths, or athletes between 5 feet and 6 feet tall; Large fits larger mouths, or athletes over 6 feet tall. SISU mouth guards are backed by a $35,000, one-year limited dental warranty. Guard is free of BPA, PVC, phthalates, and latex. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Medium sports mouthguard offers premium warrantied dental protection; fits average mouths, or athletes between 5 and 6 feet tall
At only 1.6mm thick, the ultralight design of the Aero is 50 percent thinner than conventional sports mouth guards, providing maximum comfort and convenience
The slim, custom fit makes it easy to talk, breathe and drink without removing the guard, which contributes to better hygiene
Diffusix technology scientifically distributes impact forces from soccer, hockey, roller derby, lacrosse, basketball, and other contact team sports
SISU guards feature a wider bite pad, rounded edges for comfort and improved mold-ability to ensure a perfect fit; quickly and easily mold (and re-mold) at home with hot water
